intro: Eremolaena humblotiana, commonly known as the Madagascar spurge, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has a short stem with thick, fleshy leaves that help store water. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
